name: Per Vices
headline: Building Mission Critical Software Defined Radio products.
description:
Per Vices builds the highest performing Software Defined Radios for mission critical applications for industries that can't live without them. Our products are modular, easy to use, provide the best possible performance, and replace a number complex sub-systems and components. 

Customers developing wireless applications use our products because they dramatically lower integration and development complexity, total cost of ownership, and time to market. Our proprietary, industry leading, technology provides the best performance and maintains an efficient abstraction layer that allows customers to easily incorporate our product into their application.

### Flexible SDR platforms for your most demanding system requirements
## What
Software defined radios (SDR) are flexible application agnostic radio systems where all radio tuning is done in hardware but all other functionality is done in software. This replaces numerous components and devices and enables a single platform to be used for a variety of applications for different markets. SDRs are also upgradeable and updateable without changing hardware. 
## Why
SDRs allow for high performance, excellent reliability, low latency, and many other benefits. Per Vices has extensive experience in configuring our highest performing platforms to work with your systems, offering full integration support, excellent communication, and services and maintenance throughout product life. We innovate and develop constantly to provide the solutions clients need.
## Who
Our customers include engineers, scientists, project managers and technologists in government companies, who have used our platform, validated its performance and economics compared to alternatives, and have received, or are seeking, regulatory approval to begin selling systems integrating our products. See who and how we work with our clients on our **[Client Process](https://www.pervices.com/</client-process>)** page. 
### FEATURES
###  High RF Bandwidth 
Each platform offers the highest bandwidth in its class with options enabling up to 16 GHz of instantaneous bandwidth in a single platform. 
###  Wide Tuning Range 
Our SDRs offer performance down to the kHz range and can extend all the way to 20 GHz and beyond. 
###  High Digital Throughput 
We offer significant advantages regarding digital throughput with our products ranging from 20 Gbps backhaul all the way to 400 Gbps backhaul. 
###  Independent Radio Chains 
All of our SDRs offer multiple radio chains with each being independently controlled for changing the tuning frequency, bandwidth, and other parts of the radio chain. 
###  Phase Coherency 
We provide deterministic phase coherency across all radio chains in a given product and can extend our phase coherency across multiple radio devices giving customers the best performance for critical applications. 
###  Custom Solutions & Full Integration Support 
We work closely with all customers to ensure a solution can be provided that meets their project requirements while providing the best integration support possible by relying on our extensive experience in integrating our platforms in customer systems and networks. 
### benefits
###  Flexibility 
Wide tuning range, MIMO operation, high bandwidth and fully configurable radio chain. 
###  Performance 
The best performance for tuning range, bandwidth, channel count, RF performance, and digital throughput. 
###  ease of integration 
Ability to change data format, custom messaging, interface types, and size, weight, and power (SWaP). 
###  RISk Reduction 
Start with one of our COTS stock products and, if needed, we can work incrementally to meet your project requirements while reducing any risk. 
###  Lower costs 
Our platforms are very competitively priced and for custom developments we can re-use our existing IP and experiences to lower costs and shorten development time. 
###  One Vendor 
By having a single vendor provide all radio needs and integration support, customers benefit from reduced supply chain complexity. 
## [CYAN](https://www.pervices.com/</cyan>)
[**Cyan**](https://www.pervices.com/</cyan>) is a high channel count, ultra wide band, high gain, direct conversion quadrature transceiver and signal processing platform. Providing simultaneous support for up 16, fully independent, transmit or receive radio channels, with a standard 1 GHz of RF bandwidth and support for up to 3 GHz, and up to 16 bit converters, this flexible platform can tune from near DC to 18 GHz. The digital throughput includes four 40GBASE-R qSFP ports to quickly receive and transmit radio data with an option to upgrade to four 100GBASE-R. **Cyan aims to provide end users with the best possible performance available from a commercial vendor.**
### [CRIMSON TNG](https://www.pervices.com/</crimson-tng>)
[**Crimson TNG**](https://www.pervices.com/</crimson-tng>) is a very flexible radio and signal processing platform that supports high bandwidth communications over a wide tuning range. The hardware has a 4 Rx and 4 Tx configuration and a tuning range from near DC to 6 GHz. Each radio chain supports bandwidths of up to 325 MHz with 16 bit resolution and Crimson TNG offers dual 10GBASE-R SFP+ ports for streaming up to 20 Gbps of data to and from interfacing equipment. 
## [CHESTNUT](https://www.pervices.com/</cyan>)
[**Chestnut**](https://www.pervices.com/</chestnut>) offers high bandwidth, extended tuning range and high digital throughput – striking the perfect balance between performance and cost, with the added benefit of being designed for easy integration. The platform offers 4 independent receive and 4 transmit chains, with up to 500 MHz bandwidth per chain. This flexible platform can tune from near DC to 9 GHz with 16 bit converters and comes in a compact 19″ 2U size and has the Intel Stratix 10 FPGA SoC. The digital throughput includes four 40GBASE-R qSFP ports to quickly provide 160 Gbps to receive and transmit radio data. 
## [CALAMINE](https://www.pervices.com/</calamine>)
[**Calamine**](https://www.pervices.com/</calamine>) is an extremely high tuning range software defined received with high bandwidth and digital throughput. This receiver offers tuning from near DC to 40 GHz with 4 independent receive radio chains, each with up to 300 MHz bandwidth per chain. This easy to integrate platform offers 16 bit converters and comes in a compact 19″ 2U size with an Arria V FPGA SoC. The digital throughput includes two 10GBASE-R SFP ports to quickly provide 20 Gbps of data transfer from the receiver to other equipment.

### Flexible SDR platforms for your most demanding system requirements
## What
Software defined radios (SDR) are flexible application agnostic radio systems where all radio tuning is done in hardware but all other functionality is done in software. This replaces numerous components and devices and enables a single platform to be used for a variety of applications for different markets. SDRs are also upgradeable and updateable without changing hardware. 
## Why
SDRs allow for high performance, excellent reliability, low latency, and many other benefits. Per Vices has extensive experience in configuring our highest performing platforms to work with your systems, offering full integration support, excellent communication, and services and maintenance throughout product life. We innovate and develop constantly to provide the solutions clients need.
## Who
Our customers include engineers, scientists, project managers and technologists in government companies, who have used our platform, validated its performance and economics compared to alternatives, and have received, or are seeking, regulatory approval to begin selling systems integrating our products. See who and how we work with our clients on our **Client Process⟨30⟩** page. 
### FEATURES
###  High RF Bandwidth 
Each platform offers the highest bandwidth in its class with options enabling up to 16 GHz of instantaneous bandwidth in a single platform. 
###  Wide Tuning Range 
Our SDRs offer performance down to the kHz range and can extend all the way to 20 GHz and beyond. 
###  High Digital Throughput 
We offer significant advantages regarding digital throughput with our products ranging from 20 Gbps backhaul all the way to 400 Gbps backhaul. 
###  Independent Radio Chains 
All of our SDRs offer multiple radio chains with each being independently controlled for changing the tuning frequency, bandwidth, and other parts of the radio chain. 
###  Phase Coherency 
We provide deterministic phase coherency across all radio chains in a given product and can extend our phase coherency across multiple radio devices giving customers the best performance for critical applications. 
###  Custom Solutions & Full Integration Support 
We work closely with all customers to ensure a solution can be provided that meets their project requirements while providing the best integration support possible by relying on our extensive experience in integrating our platforms in customer systems and networks. 
### benefits
###  Flexibility 
Wide tuning range, MIMO operation, high bandwidth and fully configurable radio chain. 
###  Performance 
The best performance for tuning range, bandwidth, channel count, RF performance, and digital throughput. 
###  ease of integration 
Ability to change data format, custom messaging, interface types, and size, weight, and power (SWaP). 
###  RISk Reduction 
Start with one of our COTS stock products and, if needed, we can work incrementally to meet your project requirements while reducing any risk. 
###  Lower costs 
Our platforms are very competitively priced and for custom developments we can re-use our existing IP and experiences to lower costs and shorten development time. 
###  One Vendor 
By having a single vendor provide all radio needs and integration support, customers benefit from reduced supply chain complexity. 
## CYAN⟨31⟩
**Cyan**⟨31⟩ is a high channel count, ultra wide band, high gain, direct conversion quadrature transceiver and signal processing platform. Providing simultaneous support for up 16, fully independent, transmit or receive radio channels, with a standard 1 GHz of RF bandwidth and support for up to 3 GHz, and up to 16 bit converters, this flexible platform can tune from near DC to 18 GHz. The digital throughput includes four 40GBASE-R qSFP ports to quickly receive and transmit radio data with an option to upgrade to four 100GBASE-R. **Cyan aims to provide end users with the best possible performance available from a commercial vendor.**
### CRIMSON TNG⟨32⟩
**Crimson TNG**⟨32⟩ is a very flexible radio and signal processing platform that supports high bandwidth communications over a wide tuning range. The hardware has a 4 Rx and 4 Tx configuration and a tuning range from near DC to 6 GHz. Each radio chain supports bandwidths of up to 325 MHz with 16 bit resolution and Crimson TNG offers dual 10GBASE-R SFP+ ports for streaming up to 20 Gbps of data to and from interfacing equipment. 
## CHESTNUT⟨31⟩
**Chestnut**⟨33⟩ offers high bandwidth, extended tuning range and high digital throughput – striking the perfect balance between performance and cost, with the added benefit of being designed for easy integration. The platform offers 4 independent receive and 4 transmit chains, with up to 500 MHz bandwidth per chain. This flexible platform can tune from near DC to 9 GHz with 16 bit converters and comes in a compact 19″ 2U size and has the Intel Stratix 10 FPGA SoC. The digital throughput includes four 40GBASE-R qSFP ports to quickly provide 160 Gbps to receive and transmit radio data. 
## CALAMINE⟨34⟩
**Calamine**⟨34⟩ is an extremely high tuning range software defined received with high bandwidth and digital throughput. This receiver offers tuning from near DC to 40 GHz with 4 independent receive radio chains, each with up to 300 MHz bandwidth per chain. This easy to integrate platform offers 16 bit converters and comes in a compact 19″ 2U size with an Arria V FPGA SoC. The digital throughput includes two 10GBASE-R SFP ports to quickly provide 20 Gbps of data transfer from the receiver to other equipment.

**Per Vices: A Summary**

Founded in 2005 and part of Y Combinator's W12 batch, Per Vices operates out of Toronto, Canada. With a small team of 11 dedicated employees, they specialize in building high-performance Software Defined Radio (SDR) products that cater to mission-critical applications across various industries, including telecommunications and IoT.

**Mission and Vision**

Per Vices leverages its expertise to design modular and easy-to-use SDR systems that not only enhance performance but also streamline the integration process for customers. Their products are aimed at reducing the complexity and costs associated with traditional wireless applications, providing a competitive edge in terms of time to market.

**Core Products**

The company has developed several standout SDR platforms:
- **Crimson TNG**: A flexible platform designed for high bandwidth communications and capable of tuning from near DC to 6 GHz.
- **Cyan**: Known for its high channel count and extensive tuning range up to 18 GHz, this platform supports multiple independent radio channels.
- **Chestnut**: Balancing performance and cost, this model offers extended tuning and high digital throughput.
- **Calamine**: Offers the highest tuning range, reaching up to 40 GHz, suitable for applications demanding precision and flexibility.

**Market Applications**
Per Vices supplies their SDR products to a diverse range of applications, including radar, GPS/GNSS, medical imaging, electronic warfare, and more. Their technology is pivotal for customers ranging from government agencies to commercial enterprises, helping them meet regulatory approvals while maintaining performance and cost-effectiveness.

**Customer-Centric Approach**
The company prides itself on its integration support and collaboration with clients to customize solutions that meet specific project requirements. Feedback from notable partners underscores their commitment to quality and responsiveness, showcasing the reliability of their products in demanding environments.

**Conclusion**
Per Vices stands as a leader in the realm of software-defined radios, providing cutting-edge solutions that simplify wireless communications while offering superior performance. With a focus on continuous innovation and customer satisfaction, they are positioned well for future growth in a rapidly evolving telecommunications landscape.

For more information, visit their website: [Per Vices](https://www.pervices.com)
